info.title: PatientEngagement.WebApi
info.description: A sample API for testing and prototyping Swashbuckle features

post.summary: Register a Patient or CarePartner - Creates a login account
Verifies the ValidationCode (either with DateOfBirth or with Phone and CountryCode)

get.summary: Checks a Base64 encoded username to see if it exists in the DB already, and if it passes the validation criteria

post.summary:
Patient or CarePartner login - Authenticates a user with the system and returns 
the token needed to make authenticated requests.
Forgot Username - sends out an SMS with the forgotten Username
User forgot password - sends out a SMS with validation code
Resets password based on validation code
Sends or queues a Forgot Password SMS message for a patient
Sends or queues a Forgot Username SMS message for a patient
Returns Active Directory authentication details

Provides a method for the client application to reauthorize the users session without providing the 
full username and password credential
Registers the care partner for patient

get.summary: Retrieves consumer configuration files based on Platform and SBI
Detailed errors to bypass asp.net default error pages

post.summary: Sends or queues a New Account SMS message for a patient
Returns a validation code if matching patient details available.

get.summary: Returns Provider Single sign on authentication details.

parameters.name: patientSearchQueryModel.accessToken
parameters.description:
Access token in Base64 format.Token should be encoded with the following Json format.
 {
    "NurseUID": "sample NurseUID",
    "System": "sample System",
    "Expiration": "2014-11-26T18:20:00.4926462+05:30",
    "Role": "sample role"
}

post.summary: Creates a new reminder for patient
Creates a new reminder for patient

put.summary: Updates reminder based on patient id and reminder id

patch.summary: Patches properties of a Reminder item

get.summary: Returns a list of reminders based on passed parameters

parameters.name: queryModel.startDate
parameters.description:
Start date of when to start getting reminders after
<example>2016-10-05T00:00:00Z</example>

parameters.name: queryModel.endDate
parameters.description:
End time of when to get reminders before
<example>2016-10-05T00:00:00Z</example>

parameters.name: queryModel.isCompleted
parameters.description:
Boolean to get reminders that are completed or not
defaults to false if not provided

parameters.name: queryModel.sort
parameters.description:
Sort direction (on date) of the returned body
if null will return ascending
<example>ascending, Ascending, descending, Descending, 0, 1</example>

parameters.name: queryModel.shouldRollupRecurring
parameters.description:
Rolls up recurring reminders so we only show the most near to being due.
Defaults to false

parameters.name: queryModel.offset
parameters.description: Number of records to skip.If not sent, defaults to 0.

parameters.name: queryModel.limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return.If not sent, defaults to 10.

get.summary: Returns a reminder based on ReminderId
Returns a list of reminders based on the ReminderSeriesId
Returns Reminder statistics (counts) by ToDo/Overdue/Completed and by Flagged

put.summary: Toggles reminder importance."isImportant" should be either true or false.

patch.summary: Patches properties of multiple Reminder items

get.summary: Returns recurring reminders based on patient id and reminder series id

delete.summary: Deletes recurring reminders based on patient id and reminder series id
Deletes recurring reminders based on patient id and reminder series id

post.summary: Creates recurring reminders for patient
Creates recurring reminders for patient

put.summary: Toggles recurring reminders importance."isImportant" should be either true or false

get.summary:
Returns a list of reminder templates for an specific clinician - 
Clinician should be already authenticated(Admin Role Required)

parameters.name: queryModel.keyword
parameters.description: Word or phrase to search against the name(title) and description of the template reminder

parameters.name: queryModel.sortColumn
parameters.description:
Column that is the primary sort order field in the returned dataset
<example>Defaults to ReminderTemplatesSortColumn.Name</example>

parameters.name: queryModel.sortDirection
parameters.description:
Sort Direction for the primary Sort Column
<example>Defaults to Ascending</example>

parameters.name: queryModel.offset
parameters.description: Number of records to skip.If not sent, defaults to 0.

parameters.name: queryModel.limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return.If not sent, defaults to 10.

get.summary:
Returns a reminder template based on ReminderTemplateId - 
Clinician should be already authenticated(Admin Role Required)

put.summary:
Updates reminder based on reminder template id - 
Clinician should be already authenticated(Admin Role Required)

delete.summary: Deletes Reminder Template - Clinician should be already authenticated(Admin Role Required)

post.summary: Receives and stores a payload of SMS Messages sent by the SaaS provider for SMS/text messages
Receives a request for authorization tokens and passes along to the centralized authorization service

CarePartnerId.description:
Care Partner ID
<example>[ex: 1]</example><remarks>Must be non-NULL if PatientId is null</remarks>

PatientId.description:
Patient ID
<example>[ex: 2]</example><remarks>Must be non-NULL if CarePartnerId is null</remarks>

Phone.description:
Phone Number
<example>+11234567890</example><remarks>Should be used with ValidationCode, NOT DateOfBirth</remarks>

DateOfBirth.description:
Date Of Birth
<remarks>Should be used with ValidationCode, NOT Phone</remarks>

IsAmPmUsed.description:
Is AM/PM Used
<example>[ex: true or false]</example>

AccessToken.description: The access token to use in further API calls for this session

ReauthToken.description: The token used to reauthorize the user and establish a new session

ExpireTime.description: The time that the AccessToken will expire

ReauthExpireTime.description: The time that the session may no longer be reauthorized

AcceptTCCommandModel.description: Accept terms and conditions command model

AccessToken.description: The access token to use in further API calls for this session

ReauthToken.description: The token used to reauthorize the user and establish a new session

DeviceId.description: A unique id created by the client application.In case,if the request is from browser,then pass "-1".It will read the IP address from the request.

FacilityId.description: A unique facility Id which the clinician is assigned to.

FirstName.description: First name of the care partner

LastName.description: Last name of the care partner

Email.description: Email address of the care partner

CarePartnerInviteCommandModel.description: Command model to invite care partner

ChatActionId.description:
Chat action id: 
1 - Initiated Video Chat,
2 - Initiated Text Chat,
3 - Forwarded Chat,
4 - Ended Video Chat,
5 - Ended Text Chat

Offset.description:
Number of records to skip
<example>Defaults to 0</example>

Limit.description:
Number of records to return
<example>Defaults to 25</example>

SortColumn.description:
Column that is the primary sort order field in the returned dataset
<example>Defaults to LastMessageSent</example>

SortDirection.description:
Sort Direction for the primary Sort Column
<example>Defaults to Ascending</example>

Offset.description: Page Number

Limit.description: Page Size

ConversationViewModel.description: Represents a single Conversation in the Conversation List

Owner.description: The plaintext name of the initiator of this Conversation

Sender.description: The plaintext name of the Sender of the last Message in this Conversation

LastMessage.description: The full text of the last message within the Conversation

Timestamp.description: The UTC Timestamp when the last message was posted within the Conversation

UnreadMessages.description: The count of unread messages within this Conversation

Title.description:
Title of the new conversation
<example>[ex: Help with Baked Salad Chips]</example>

AlertGroupId.description: The identifier of the optional clinician group that will be alerted of this new conversation

ConversationAlertGroupsViewModel.description: Represents the list of Alert Groups that can get notified upon creation of a new Conversation

AlertGroupId.description: The identifier of an Alert Group

AlertGroup.description: The plaintext name of the Alert Group

Offset.description:
Number of records to skip
<example>Defaults to 0</example>

Limit.description:
Number of records to return
<example>Defaults to 25</example>

SortColumn.description:
Column that is the primary sort order field in the returned dataset
<example>Defaults to CreatedDate</example>

SortDirection.description:
Sort Direction for the primary Sort Column
<example>Defaults to Ascending</example>

ConversationMessagesViewModel.description: Represents all of the Messages within a single Conversation

Offset.description: Page Number

Limit.description: Page Size

ConversationMessageViewModel.description: Represents a single Message in a Conversation

Sender.description: The plaintext name of the Sender

Text.description: The text content of the message

Timestamp.description: The timestamp when the message was sent

ViewedOn.description: The timestamp when the message was viewed

Text.description:
The text of the message
<remarks>1000 maximum characters if Patient-authenticated
2000 maximum characters if Clinician-authenticated</remarks><example>[ex: Help me with Baked Salad Chips]</example>

Keyword.description: Word or phrase to search against the name(title) of medication.

SortColumn.description: Column that is the primary sort order field in the returned dataset

SortDirection.description: Sort Direction for the primary Sort Column

Offset.description:
The index of the result in the resultset to return as the first result of the requested page of results.
If not sent, defaults to 0.

Limit.description:
Number of records to return for the current page of results
If not sent, defaults to 10.

Limit.description: Page Size

Description.description: Medication description

ViewedOn.description: The date this record was viewed

<example>[ex: 1,2,3,4,5]</example>

SMSOptinTwo.description: Date and time of second SMS opt-in

Providers.description: Patient's providers (the list of IDs they are permitted to Video/Text Chat with)

FirstName.description: First name of the care partner

LastName.description: Last name of the care partner

Email.description: Email address of the care partner

FirstName.description: First Name of the care provider

LastName.description: Last Name of the care provider

MessageType.description: Type of message to send, currently supported values: 'NewUserInvite'

Platform.description: Platform to send message to, if specified must be either "android" or "ios".

Last name of the patient
<example>[ex: Smith]</example>

First name of the patient
<example>[ex: Joe]</example>

<example>[ex: username1]</example>

Email address of the patient
<example>[ex: patient@davita.com]</example>

First name of the patient
<example>[ex: Joe]</example>

LastName.description:
Last name of the patient
<example>[ex: Smith]</example>

Roles.description:
Role Ids that are assigned to provider
<example>3,4</example><remarks>Old Clinician Portal uses this</remarks>

DetailedRoles.description:
Role objects that are assigned to provider
<remarks>New Clinician Portal uses this</remarks>

Bio.description:
Biodata of Clinician
<example>[ex: Born at a very young age]</example>

Picture.description:
Profile picture of Clinician 
<example>[ex: Base64 byte array]</example>

Keyword.description: Searches on  First Name,Last Name and Source Patient Id of the Patient.

AssignedOnly.description:
This parameter will be considered only if the provider has Roaster role along with the other roles (Global,CSS)
If the provider has only "Roster" role, then "AssignedOnly" will be considered as true,even though if passed false.

DueDates.description:
Due Dates for the reminder, each one will create a new reminder
<example>[ex: "2016-12-25T13:45:00Z","2016-12-26T13:45:00Z"]</example>

RemindMeMinutes.description: Time in minutes for reminder times. Must be a comma separated string. Should be passed only when remind me times were specified.

Offset.description: Page Number

Limit.description: Page Size

Description.description: Description of the Reminder

DueDate.description: Due Date.This will not be visible for recurring reminders.

TimeZoneName.description: The name of the time zone used by a Clinician when creating this Reminder

ViewedOn.description: Time the patiented viewed the reminder

ReminderId.description:
Reminder Id
<remarks>This will not be visible for recurring reminders</remarks>

ReminderSeriesId.description:
Reminder Series Id
<remarks>This will be visible only for recurring reminders</remarks>

Count.description: The total of rolled up reminders (If ShouldRollupRecurring=true)

RecurrenceType.description: Recurrence Type.This will be visible only for recurring reminders.

StartDate.description: Start Date.This will be visible only for recurring reminders.

EndDate.description: End Date.This will be visible only for recurring reminders.

ResourceAssignedDate.description: Date when Resource was assigned to Reminder

RemindMeMinutes.description: Minutes before DueDate to notify about this Reminder

Resource.description: Resource model for the resource which is attached to the reminder

IsClinicianCreated.description:
Whether a Clinician created this recurring reminder
<example>[ex: true/false]</example>

Description.description: Description of the Reminder

UpdatedOn.description: Last date the Reminder was updated on

IsActive.description: Is the Reminder currently active or not

IsCustomResource.description: Is the reminder a custom resource?

RecurringReminderV2ViewModel.description: Recurring Reminders V2 View Model class

Name.description:
Name of the Reminder
<example>[ex: Take your meds]</example>

Description.description:
Description of the Reminder
<example>[ex: Medication needs to be taken on a regular basis for best results]</example>

TimeZoneName.description:
The name of the time zone used by a Clinician when creating this Reminder
<example>[ex: EST/CST/MST/PST]</example>

Weekdays.description: Week days for the weekly reminder(combination of M,T,W,Th,F,S,Su).Should be a comma separated string.Should be passed only in case of weekly reminder.

MonthlyDeliveryDay.description:
Delivery day of the monthly reminder.
1) Max value can be 31.
2) In case of 29,30,31 dates,it will fall back to the last day of the month for the months not having these dates.
3) In case of "Last Day of the month", pass -1.
4) This should be passed only in case of monthly reminder.

AlertTimes.description:
Contains an string array of 24-hour times (assumed to be the time zone listed in TimeZoneName property)
<remarks>Maximum of 6 of these are allowed!</remarks><example>[ex. "01:15", "12:45", "14:45", "20:00"]</example>

RemindMeMinutes.description:
Time in minutes for reminder times. Must be a comma separated string. Should be passed only when remind me times were specified.
<example>[ex. "30,60,120,1440,2880,4320"]</example>

IsClinicianCreated.description:
Whether a Clinician created this recurring reminder
<example>[ex: true/false]</example>

NumCompleted.description: Total of all completed Reminders for this Patient

NumToDo.description: Total of all ToDo/Upcoming Reminders for this Patient

NumOverdue.description: Total of all Overdue Reminders for this Patient

NumFlagged.description: Total of all Flagged Reminders for this Patient

<example>[ex: EST/CST/MST/PST]</example>

Weekdays.description: Week days for the weekly reminder(combination of M,T,W,Th,F,S,Su).Should be a comma separated string.Should be passed only in case of weekly reminder.

MonthlyDeliveryDay.description:
Delivery day of the monthly reminder.
1) Max value can be 31.
2) In case of 29,30,31 dates,it will fall back to the last day of the month for the months not having these dates.
3) In case of "Last Day of the month", pass -1.
4) This should be passed only in case of monthly reminder.

Recommended.description:
If Recommended not passed, then returns all global resources along with the patient's group resources.
If Recommended=true, then returns only recommended patient resources.
If Recommended=false, then returns all global resources along with the patient's group resources which are not recommended.

Keyword.description: Searches on Name and Description properties of the resource record

CategoryId.description: The Resource Category to search within, if not provided then resources from all categories are returned

IsViewed.description:
This parameter will be considered only if "Recommended=true"
If IsViewed not passed returns all patient resources.
If IsViewed=true, then returns only viewed  patient resources.       
If IsViewed=false, then returns only non viewed patient resources.

Offset.description: Number of records to skip. If not sent, defaults to 0.

Limit.description: Number of records to return. If not sent, defaults to 10.

Offset.description: Page Number

Limit.description: Page Size

Description.description: Resource Description

AssignedDate.description: Date when resource was assigned to patient

IsCustomResource.description: If Resource is a custom resource,then true else false.

IsRemindersAvailable.description: If Reminders available for resource,then true else false.

ViewedOn.description: The date this record was viewed

CategoryId.description: Resource category ID to filter by

Keyword.description: Searches on Name and Description properties of the resource record

Offset.description: Number of records to skip.If not sent, defaults to 0.

Limit.description: Number of records to return.If not sent, defaults to 10.

Offset.description: Page Number

Limit.description: Page Size

Description.description: Resource Description

CategoryId.description: Category ID the resource belongs to

IsCustomResource.description: If Resource is a custom resource,then true else false.

Ids of Resources that should have ViewedOn datetime stamp set

SMSMessagesCommandModel.description: Model class for receiving SMS messages

Data.description: Model class for a collection of SMS messages

Record.description: Model class for details of a single SMS message

cleanText.description: Plaintext string without any HTML markup

text.description: Text content of the SMS message (may contain markup)

keyword.description: The keyword(s) used when searching all messages

timestamp.description: The timestamp when this SMS message arrived

receiver.description: The receiver phone number (E.164 without leading + symbol)

smsCount.description: The count of individual SMS messages used to transmit the full text of the message

sender.description: The sender phone number (E.164 without leading + symbol)

TokenCommandModel.description: Basic model for sending username and password to centralized authentication service
